subject: Self Care
title: Temperature and Sleep
description: Learn Temperature and Sleep in one minute.

hook.text: A hot bedroom is one of the most common sleep killers, and most people set their thermostat too high.

buildup.text: Your core body temperature must drop by about one degree Celsius to initiate and maintain sleep.

discovery.text: The ideal bedroom temperature for sleep is around 65 degrees Fahrenheit, or about 18 degrees Celsius.

twist.text: A warm bath before bed paradoxically helps. It draws blood to the surface, cooling your core faster.

climax.text: Cool room, warm blanket. This combination lets your body regulate temperature naturally all night.

punchline.text: Cool the room. Your brain needs cold to sleep.

quiz.question: What is the ideal bedroom temperature for sleep?
